Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: UmamaMars
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Rome, and the hotel was kind, friendly, clean and above all expectations! The pastry shop on the ground floor was amazing! The beds were nice and firm, The shower was top notch, We arrived late with two tired babies and and cranky teenager, but were treated like royalty all through the three night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mrpcok
Reviews.Content: Would highly reccommend stayed here for 5 nights and enjoyed it. Well run clean and friendly staff. A great location for sightseeing. only negative was having to pay for air con!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Mopeey
Reviews.Content: I was desperate in my last minute search for a hotel in Rome and stumbled upon Hotel Silla. Upon reading the reviews, I thought I'd give it a shot. We stayed in Hotel Silla for 6 nights and it was good! The room may be small and no breakfast was included in the price. But it located in a good and safe neighbourhood with lots of nearby cafes and restaurants. It was also a stone's throw away from the Metro and a 5 min walk to the Vatican City. The hotel was clean and we totally enjoyed our stay there. There was a patisserie just down below and we woke up every morning to the lovely smell of whatever they were baking downstairs! I give it top marks for location too! Just a little note. If you need air-conditioning, you'll have to pay extra. The show area is really, really tiny, so not advisable if you are really huge. It can be a little noisy if you have rooms facing the courtyard cos the patisserie opens quite early. There's free wifi but can be a little dodgy. Other than that, it was great! The hotel recommended us a typical roman trattoria just down the road called Ragno D'oro. It serves amazing local, homecooked dishes. And we reckon the food's really good cos it was packed EVERY NIGHT with locals! We went back there almost every day of our stay in Rome! Good recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in pleasant neighbourhood with very helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SallyandRichard_10
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in Hotel Silla for 9 days and really enjoyed our time there. The staff were very helpful and friendly - Stefano on reception was very welcoming, gave useful advice and we were grateful his English was so good as our Italian was very limited! Ottaviano metro was very close to the hotel - just around the corner and so we could get into the centre of town in about 15 minutes. There were also cafes, restaurants and wine bars a few minutes walk away. There was a bakery sharing a courtyard with the hotel so I especially liked the lovely aroma of freshly baked pastries in the mornings! away for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay, Kind Staff, Clean Accommodations, Safe Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: marysoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Silla in May 2010 and found it to be delightful. The host at the reception desk, Stefano, was kind, helpful, and spoke very good English. The room and bathroom are small, clean, and quaint. We could order cafe any time of day from the reception desk. The neighborhood is lovely and the hotel is right next to an Internet Cafe, which is very convenient. It is also very close to the subway, several good restaurants, an old cinema, and the Vatican--all within a short walk! We were very happy with our stay at Hotel Silla and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: edwt
Reviews.Content: See title. Booked hotel as part of a Delta Airlines package. Room was basic and fairly small, same for bath. Good reading lights, uncommon. Location superb, 100 metres from metro and numerous buses, close to Vatican. Iphone reception marginal. Considerate and knowledgeable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever experienced - including Asia”
Reviews.Author: crhannaford
Reviews.Content: Where do I start - an obnoxious boorish host, a rude chamber maid - the smallest shower on earth. Thin grubby towels. Old smelly room overlooking a mould rank courtyard. No internet connection that was blamed on our PC and Mac that had worked in three other locations just fine. No lounge and the most saggy uncomfortable beds -- then to be turfed out in the rain when we had paid for the extra night charged when we arranged to leave. Thoroughly horrible - don't book here!

Reviews.Title: “Ok standard”
Reviews.Author: Rune&B
Reviews.Content: Wtayed there for two nights. Found the stadard good compared to the price. Good location close to the Vatican and to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoDomingo
Reviews.Content: Magnific service and location,this small Hotel is very clean, three bloks away from the Vatican, the Metro is at the corner of the street, and most of all, they treat you very friendly and with professionalism. The personnel at the front desk was very kind and helpfull,they spoke both spanish and english fluently and booked all our tours, taxis,and explained the correct way to visit Rome, via Metro , Bus ,and important places to visit, nearby like restaurants ( they suggested a Cafe and a magnificent Trattoria (restaurant) Ragno-Magno, just at the corner.The room was confortable, very clean, and beautifull. I will return here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Silla!”
Reviews.Author: Flavia27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend our summer vacation in Italy this year. Although we had visited Rome on previous occasions, we were never really satisfied with our accomodations. Not so this time around! We lucked out and found this fantastic little hotel, Hotel Silla, about 200 meters from St. Peter's Square and Castel Sant'Angelo, one of the prettiest places in Rome. The hotel is situated on the second and third floors of a building on Silla road, just a few steps away from the Ottaviano Subway stop. It is a small, family run hotel which added to its charm. The staff were very friendly and were always ready to offer advice if asked. The room we had was immaculately clean and well appointed with a double bed, an in-room safe, a generous bathroom and air conditioning if we wanted it. It was also very quiet (hard to find a quiet room in Rome!) as our room faced the inner courtyard of the building. The hotel does provide breakfast for a small additional charge. This hotel is perfect for those people that want a nice place to stay for a reasonable price. Trust us, you won't find a better place in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: cymry
Reviews.Content: this little hotel is no more, no less than a place to sleep while you explore the area around the Vatican. the locals speak very little English, so communication was a bit difficult (though they were all very friendly and we managed to make ourselves understood). this is NOT a touristy area, so there's not much to do other than the Vatican attractions, or wander over one of the bridges into the main part of the city, which we did rapidly on the first day. breakfast is at an extra charge, but there's a pastry shop a few streets away, so we made it a habit to pick up our breakfast the night before. not a great place, but not terrible either.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad find”
Reviews.Author: easilver
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (both 30 year olds) needed a place to stay in Rome after a cruise. Given our late booking and high season prices, everything in town was ridiculously expensive. The Hotel Silla was a good compromise. We paid 135 euros/night for a room with two twin beds. That's pretty high for what the place was worth, but probably about right in the completely inflated market. The room was very clean, had a TV, wardrobe, desk table, and two chairs. The bathroom was pretty spacious for an Italian bathroom, though the shower was small (I've experienced smaller in Italy) and the towels were closer to paper towels than soft fluffy towels. The mattresses and pillows were harder than I'd like. Our room was on the "second" floor (third, in American-ese), with two flights of steps to reach it and no elevator. The steps were shorter than normal, if that makes sense, and not too hard to navigate with my heavy suitcase. We could've chosen a "first" floor room one flight up, but it was having hot water problems. Our room overlooked a courtyard, off of which was a bakers' production shop so our room always smelled wonderful. It did a little noisy first thing in the morning when the bakers showed up for work but was pretty quiet at night. There was no A/C. All of the receptionists were very nice and spoke English. They arranged a car to take us to the airport (47 euros) and gave us restaurant recommendations and a corkscrew when we needed one. The hotel was a block from the Ottaviano metro and an easy walk to the Vatican. Lots of great shops and restaurants nearby. At these prices, I wouldn't recommend this hotel as your first choice, but it's not a bad place to stay and the location is great.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Silla
HotelInfo.Address: Via Silla 3, 00192 Rome, Italy
